snippet: The Obama administration legal team is divided over whether to drop two terrorism cases, a decision that could significantly reduce the number of other prisoners who can receive tribunal trials.
abstract: Obama administration legal team is divided over whether to drop two terrorism cases originally prosecuted in military commission at Guantanamo Bay, Cuba, decision that could significantly reduce number of other prisoners who can receive tribunal trials.
lead_paragraph: The Obama administration legal team is divided over whether to drop two terrorism cases, a decision that could significantly reduce the number of other prisoners who can receive tribunal trials.

headline.seo: U.S. Lawyers Divided Over Prosecuting Terrorism Cases
headline.main: U.S. Legal Officials Split Over How to Prosecute Terrorism Detainees
headline.print_headline: U.S. Legal Officials Split Over How to Prosecute Terrorism Detainees

keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
keywords.name: subject
